text: 4. Serosa — Outermost layer, which is made up of the visceral peritoneum » Formed from areolar connective tissue covered with mesothelium (single layer of squamous epithelium) in most organs * Replaced by fibrous adventitia in esophagus — Dense connective tissue that holds esophagus to surrounding structures » Retroperitoneal organs have both an adventitia and a serosa
